description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ce9m4","text":"Protocol for the preparation of a standard for DNA library quantification by quantitative real-time PCR (Meyer et al. 2008; Gansauge et al. 2020). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4n2l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36orv","text":"References","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7klq2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9p8h","text":"Meyer, M., Briggs, A. W., Maricic, T., Höber, B., Höffner, B., Krause, J., Weihmann, A., Pääbo, S., \u0026 Hofreiter, M. (2008). From micrograms to picograms: Quantitative PCR reduces the material demands of high-throughput sequencing. Nucleic Acids Research, 36(1): e5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f69h6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99nq0","text":"Gansauge, M.-T., Aximu-Petri, A., Nagel, S. et al. Manual and automated preparation of single-stranded DNA libraries for the \nsequencing of DNA from ancient biological remains and other sources of highly degraded DNA. Nature Protocols,15, 2279-2300 (2020).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehmpf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fj3ur","text":"Notes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct0fh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61q4b","text":"The qPCR standard comprises of a 60 bp fragment of pUC19 sequence flanked by double-indexed Illumina adapters. Indices are qPCR specific and not used for the preparation of sample libraries. The standard is obtained through two successive PCRs. It is then purified, quantified and diluted to concentrations between 10^8 and 10^2 molecules per micro liter. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lk9a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25o3j","text":"Materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5o40","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"584ov","text":"* Order oligonucleotide CL105_makeSTD103.F at 1µmol synthesis scale (Integrated DNA Technologies, desalted). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c55bu","text":"Dissolve in TE buffer at a concentration of 100 µM. Prepare a 10 µM working dilution in water. Sequence: ACACTCTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCTTCCTCGTCGTTTGGTATGGCTTC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpjo","text":"† Order oligonucleotide CL106_makeSTD103.R at 1µmol synthesis scale (Integrated DNA Technologies, desalted). Dissolve in TE buffer at a concentration of 100 µM.  Prepare a 10 µM working dilution in water. Sequence: GTGACTGGAGTTCAGACGTGTGCTCTTCCGATCTTCATGTAACTCGCCTTGATCGT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6necv","text":"‡ Order oligonucleotide P5_iPCR_qPCR_xxQ188 at 1µmol synthesis scale (Integrated DNA Technologies, HPLC purified). Dissolve in TE buffer at a concentration of 100 µM.  Prepare a 10 µM working dilution in water. Sequence: AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACACCAATTCAACACTCTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCTT ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1t0ml","text":"§ Order oligonucleotide P7_iPCR_qPCR_xxQ  at 1µmol synthesis scale (Integrated DNA Technologies, HPLC purified).  Prepare a 10 µM working dilution in water. Dissolve in TE buffer at a concentration of 100 µM. Sequence: AGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGATACCACAGTGACTGGAGTTCAGACGTGT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jvl6","text":"‖ See document in the Appendix for the preparation of TET buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d82ac","text":"¶ See document in the Appendix for the preparation of TE buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63ri0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mc95","text":"Equipment ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ek71","text":"Thermal cycler for PCR strip tubes (e.g., Bio-Rad C1000 Touch Thermal Cycler, cat. no. 1840197)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mlgf","text":"NanoDrop spectrophotometer (Model ND-1000 V3.8.1)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cbjo","text":"Agilent 2100 Bioanalyser 2100 expert DNA 1000 Series II (cat. no. G2938C)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f703","text":"Label printer (e.g. Brady M611, cat. no. M611-EU-LABS) and tube labels (e.g. labels for TLS2200/TLS PC Link/Polyester, cat. no. PTL-82-499)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"euo14","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9726p","text":"Protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnt92","text":"1.  In a 0.2-ml PCR eight-tube strip, prepare the following reaction mix using 1ng of pUC19 plasmid DNA as template and primers CL105 and CL106. Mix properly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ufae","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8o77q","text":"2. Place the strip tube into a thermal cycler and perform cycling with the following temperature profile.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kluk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3tn0d","text":"3. Purify the PCR product using the MinElute PCR Puriﬁcation Kit following the manufacturer’s instructions. Elute in 30 μl TE buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3dsa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jr65","text":"4. Determine the concentration of the PCR product using the NanoDrop spectrophotometer. The expected concentration range is 50–100 ng/μl. Dilute PCR product to 1 ng / μl in TE buffer in a 1.5-ml Eppendorf LoBind Tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arr4a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ucki","text":"5. In a 0.2-ml PCR eight-tube strip, prepare the following reaction mix use 1ng of the purified PCR product as template for a second amplification with a combination of P5 and P7 indexing primers used only for preparing the qPCR standard. Mix properly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frh7d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7s6lv","text":"6. Place the strip tube into a thermal cycler and perform cycling with the following temperature profile.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3otcn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"39llj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3drm8","text":"7. Purify the PCR product using the MinElute PCR Purification Kit. Elute in 30 µl TE buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cqeg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajdd6","text":"8. Measure the DNA concentration on a DNA-1000 chip using the Bioanalyzer 2100. Calculate the concentration of the PCR products in molecules per µl, e.g. using the Promega Biomath Calculator (https://www.promega.de/en/resources/tools/biomath/) and the Avogadro constant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":192,"length":50}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ec3i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t35o","text":"9. Dilute the purified PCR product to 1010 copies/µl in TET buffer in a 1.5-ml Eppendorf LoBind Tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":40,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s3b6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bleh3","text":"10. Prepare a ten-fold dilution series in TET buffer ranging from 109 to 102 copies/μl as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":68,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":75,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak3ef","text":"Prepare a ten-fold dilution (109 copies/µl) by combining 100µl of the 1010 dilution with 900µl TET buffer in a 1.5-ml Eppendorf LoBind Tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":31,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":72,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jf38","text":"Use the same scheme for further dilutions until reaching 102 copies/µl. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":59,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u40p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4esn","text":"11. Aliquot 100µl per dilution into one or more 0.2-ml PCR eight-tube strips to obtain one or more working aliquots of qPCR standard. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lp6c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dva4m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4n2mr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ul2e","text":"12. Store stock and working aliquots at −20 °C until
